intro: Rebis alpinoides, commonly known as the alpine rebis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring or early summer. Rebis alpinoides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
